intro: Dichapetalum gassitae, commonly known as the Gassita mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant often grows in rocky or disturbed soils. Dichapetalum gassitae is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in forested or open slopes.
